document_data.mainbody: '''Havarlan''' was a [[silver dragon]] "[[paladin]]" who devoted herself to the [[dragon]] [[god]] [[Xymor]] and led the [[Talons of Justice]] until her death in [[1373 DR]].
document_data.Description: In her silver dragon form, she had several scars from her many crusades. While traveling, she usually took the form of a [[humanoid]] female [[warrior]] with silver-blonde hair.
document_data.Personality: Havarlan was a dedicated, almost fanatical, crusader against evil. She was oath-sworn to the ''[[Bahamut#Dogma|Ptarian Code]]'' and specifically to the tenets of Xymor.
document_data.Lair: Unlike most dragons, Havarlan had no lair. Instead, she was a wandering dragon.
document_data.Abilities: Thanks to her dedication to Xymor, the dragon god had given her powers similar to those of the paladins. In return for those powers, Havarlan had to donate half of her treasure to the communal funds of the Talons.
document_data.History:
In 1373 DR, she send two of her Talons, [[Azhaq]] and [[Moonwing]], to capture the [[song dragon]] [[Karasendrieth]] under orders of the [[King of Justice]] [[Lareth]] for defiance of council's decisions about the abnormal [[Rage of Dragons]] of that year.

When Lareth and his lieutenant [[Tamarand]] challenged each other over whether to help humanoid races against the Rage, Havarlan was chosen to be one of the witnesses of the duel, the other being the powerful gold dragon [[sorcerer]] [[Larendrammagar]].

After being decided to help the humanoid races, Havarlan led a group of [[metallic dragon]]s to broke the siege of [[chromatic dragon]]s to the [[Monastery of the Yellow Rose]].

In the final battle against [[Sammaster]], Havarlan led all her Talons against the draconic horde of Sammaster. Amid the battle, she engaged Sammaster on her own and was killed by the [[necromancer]].
